meanings.definition: Below the size or mass of a star.
meanings.sent1: The tiny rock was so substellar that it couldn't even be seen in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The substellar asteroid was too small to create its own light.
meanings.sent3: The substellar pebble felt jealous of the shining stars above.
meanings.sent4: Her impact on the project was substellar, barely noticeable among the team's efforts.
meanings.sent5: The substellar plant struggled to grow under the shadow of the towering trees.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an object that is not a star.
meanings.sent1: The substellar planet had a unique atmosphere different from any star.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study substellar bodies to understand more about the universe.
meanings.sent3: The substellar moon orbited the giant planet in a mesmerizing dance.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were substellar, shining brightly in the field of astronomy.
meanings.sent5: The substellar galaxy was a mystery waiting to be explored by astronomers.

meanings.definition: Situated or occurring beneath a star.
meanings.sent1: The substellar clouds drifted peacefully under the bright sun.
meanings.sent2: The substellar region was cooler compared to the star's surface.
meanings.sent3: The substellar valley provided a shady spot for picnics on sunny days.
meanings.sent4: Her substellar position in the company allowed her to observe the stars during night shifts.
meanings.sent5: The substellar city twinkled under the starlit sky, a beautiful sight to behold.
